required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of a Ascensia ONYX NEXT Investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System
clinical_study.official_title: User Performance of the ONYX NEXT Blood Glucose Monitoring System

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to determine if untrained subjects with diabetes and without diabetes could operate the Investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System (BGMS) and obtain valid glucose results.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent of Self-Test Fingerstick Blood Glucose (BG) Results (From Subjects WITH Diabetes) Within +/- 15mg/dL (<100mg/dL) and Within +/- 15% (>=100 mg/dL) of Laboratory Glucose Method
primary_outcome.description: Untrained subjects WITH Diabetes (332) self-tested fingerstick blood using an Investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System (BGMS). BGMS results were compared with subject capillary plasma BG results obtained with a Yellow Springs Instrument (YSI) Analyzer. YSI Analyzer BG results were used to calculate the percent of BGMS results within +/- 15 mg/dL (<100 mg/dL YSI capillary plasma) and +/- 15% (>=100 mg/dL YSI capillary plasma).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Alternate Site Palm Blood Glucose (BG) Results (From Subjects WITH Diabetes) Within +/- 15mg/dL (<100mg/dL) and Within +/- 15% (>=100 mg/dL) of Laboratory Glucose Method
secondary_outcome.description: Untrained subjects WITH Diabetes (332) self-tested Alternate Site (AST) palm blood using an Investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System (BGMS). BGMS results were compared with subject capillary plasma BG results obtained with a Yellow Springs Instrument (YSI) Analyzer. YSI Analyzer BG results were used to calculate the percent of BGMS results within +/- 15 mg/dL (<100 mg/dL YSI capillary plasma) and +/- 15% (>=100 mg/dL YSI capillary plasma).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Subject Fingerstick Blood Glucose (BG) Results (From Subjects WITH Diabetes) Within +/- 15mg/dL (<100mg/dL) and Within +/- 15% (>=100 mg/dL) of Laboratory Glucose Method When Tested by Study Staff
secondary_outcome.description: Study staff tested subject (332 WITH diabetes) fingerstick blood using an Investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System (BGMS). BGMS results were compared with subject capillary plasma BG results obtained with a Yellow Springs Instrument (YSI) Analyzer. YSI Analyzer BG results were used to calculate the percent of BGMS results within +/- 15 mg/dL (<100 mg/dL YSI capillary plasma) and +/- 15% (>=100 mg/dL YSI capillary plasma).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Venous Blood Glucose (BG) Results (From Subjects WITH Diabetes) Within +/- 15mg/dL (<100mg/dL) and Within +/- 15% (>=100 mg/dL) of Laboratory Glucose Method When Tested by Study Staff
secondary_outcome.description: Study staff tested venous blood of 332 subjects WITH diabetes using an Investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System (BGMS). Venous BGMS results were compared with subject venous plasma BG results obtained with a Yellow Springs Instrument (YSI) Analyzer. YSI Analyzer venous plasma BG results were used to calculate the percent of BGMS results within +/- 15 mg/dL (<100 mg/dL YSI venous plasma) and +/- 15% (>=100 mg/dL YSI venous plasma).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Self-Test Fingerstick Blood Glucose (BG) Results Within +/- 15% of Laboratory Glucose Method Across the Tested Glucose Range
secondary_outcome.description: Untrained subjects WITH Diabetes (332) and WITHOUT Diabetes (43) self-tested fingerstick blood using an Investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System (BGMS). BGMS results were compared with subject capillary plasma BG results obtained with a Yellow Springs Instrument (YSI) Analyzer. YSI Analyzer BG results were used to calculate the percent of BGMS results within +/- 15% of the laboratory reference method across the entire tested YSI glucose range.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Self-Test Fingerstick Blood Glucose (BG) Results Within +/- 20% of Laboratory Glucose Method Across the Tested Glucose Range
secondary_outcome.description: Untrained subjects WITH diabetes (332) and WITHOUT diabetes (43) self-tested Fingerstick blood using an Investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System (BGMS). BGMS results were compared with subject capillary plasma BG results obtained with a Yellow Springs Instrument (YSI) Analyzer. YSI Analyzer BG results were used to calculate the percent of BGMS results within +/- 20% of the laboratory reference method across the entire tested YSI glucose range.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Self-Test Alternate Site Palm Blood Glucose (BG) Results Within +/- 15% of Laboratory Glucose Method Across the Tested Glucose Range
secondary_outcome.description: Untrained subjects WITH diabetes (332) and WITHOUT diabetes (43) self-tested AST palm blood using an Investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System (BGMS). BGMS results were compared with subject capillary plasma BG results obtained with a Yellow Springs Instrument (YSI) Analyzer. YSI Analyzer BG results were used to calculate the percent of BGMS results within +/- 15% of the laboratory reference method across the entire tested YSI glucose range.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Self-Test Alternate Site Palm Blood Glucose (BG) Results Within +/- 20% of Laboratory Glucose Method Across the Tested Glucose Range
secondary_outcome.description: Untrained subjects WITH diabetes (332) and WITHOUT diabetes (43) self-tested AST palm blood using an Investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System (BGMS). BGMS results were compared with subject capillary plasma BG results obtained with a Yellow Springs Instrument (YSI) Analyzer. YSI Analyzer BG results were used to calculate the percent of BGMS results within +/- 20% of the laboratory reference method across the entire tested YSI glucose range.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Subject Fingerstick Blood Glucose (BG) Results Within +/- 15% of Laboratory Glucose Method When Tested By Study Staff
secondary_outcome.description: Study staff tested subject (332 WITH and 43 WITHOUT diabetes) fingerstick blood using an Investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System (BGMS). BGMS results were compared with subject capillary plasma BG results obtained with a Yellow Springs Instrument (YSI) Analyzer. YSI Analyzer BG results were used to calculate the percent of BGMS results within +/- 15% of the laboratory method across the entire tested YSI glucose range.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Subject Fingerstick Blood Glucose (BG) Results Within +/- 20% of Laboratory Glucose Method When Tested By Study Staff
secondary_outcome.description: Study staff tested subject (332 WITH and 43 WITHOUT diabetes) fingerstick blood using an Investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System (BGMS). BGMS results were compared with subject capillary plasma BG results obtained with a Yellow Springs Instrument (YSI) Analyzer. YSI Analyzer BG results were used to calculate the percent of BGMS results within +/- 20% of the laboratory method across the entire tested YSI glucose range.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Self-Test Fingerstick Blood Glucose (BG) Results Within +/- 12.5mg/dL (<100mg/dL) and Within +/- 12.5% (>=100 mg/dL) of Laboratory Glucose Method
secondary_outcome.description: Untrained subjects WITH Diabetes (332) self-tested fingerstick blood using an Investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System (BGMS). BGMS results were compared with subject capillary plasma BG results obtained with a Yellow Springs Instrument (YSI) Analyzer. YSI Analyzer BG results were used to calculate the percent of BGMS results within +/- 12.5 mg/dL (<100 mg/dL YSI capillary plasma) and +/- 12.5% (>=100 mg/dL YSI capillary plasma).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Responses From Persons WITH Diabetes That Either 'Strongly Agree' or 'Agree' or Are 'Neutral' With Questionnaire Statements Regarding BGMS
secondary_outcome.description: Staff obtained responses from persons WITH Diabetes (332) using short questionnaires to provide feedback on instructions for use and the basic operation of the BGMS. Subjects could respond 'Strongly Agree' or 'Agree' or are 'Neutral' or 'Disagree' or 'Strongly Disagree'.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Responses From Persons WITH and WITHOUT Diabetes That Either 'Strongly Agree' or 'Agree' or Are 'Neutral' With Questionnaire Statements Regarding BGMS
secondary_outcome.description: Staff obtained responses from persons WITH and WITHOUT Diabetes using short questionnaires to provide feedback on instructions for use and the basic operation of the BGMS. Subjects could respond 'Strongly Agree' or 'Agree' or are 'Neutral' or 'Disagree' or 'Strongly Disagree'.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Responses From Persons WITH Diabetes That Either 'Strongly Agree' or 'Agree' or Are 'Neutral' With Questionnaire Statements Regarding Views/Behaviors Related to Self-Monitoring Blood Glucose
secondary_outcome.description: Staff obtained responses from persons WITH Diabetes using short questionnaires to provide feedback on views and behaviors related to managing their diabetes. Subjects could respond 'Strongly Agree' or 'Agree' or are 'Neutral' or 'Disagree' or 'Strongly Disagree' or 'Choose Not to Answer'.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Self-Test Fingerstick Blood Glucose (BG) Results (From Subjects WITH and WITHOUT Diabetes) Within +/- 15 mg/dL (<75 mg/dL) and Within +/- 15% (>= 75 mg/dL) of Laboratory Glucose Method
secondary_outcome.description: Untrained subject WITH and WITHOUT diabetes self-tested fingerstick blood using an investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System (BGMS). BGMS results were compared with subject capillary plasma BG results obtained with a Yellow Springs Instrument (YSI) Analyzer. YSI Analyzer BG results were used to calculate the percent of BGMS results within +/- 15 mg/dL (< 75 mg/dL YSI capillary plasma) and +/- 15% (>= 75 mg/dL YSI capillary plasma).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Self-Test Alternate Site Palm Blood Glucose (BG) Results (From Subjects WITH and WITHOUT Diabetes) Within +/- 15 mg/dL (<75 mg/dL) and Within +/- 15% (>= 75 mg/dL) of Laboratory Glucose Method
secondary_outcome.description: Untrained subject WITH and WITHOUT diabetes self-tested Alternate Site (AST) palm blood using an investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System (BGMS). BGMS results were compared with subject capillary plasma BG results obtained with a Yellow Springs Instrument (YSI) Analyzer. YSI Analyzer BG results were used to calculate the percent of BGMS results within +/- 15 mg/dL (< 75 mg/dL YSI capillary plasma) and +/- 15% (>= 75 mg/dL YSI capillary plasma).

arm_group.description: Untrained Subjects WITH Diabetes Use the ONYX NEXT BGMS (Blood Glucose Monitoring System).

intervention.description: Untrained Persons WITH Diabetes Use the ONYX NEXT BGMS (Blood Glucose Monitoring System). Subjects tested capillary fingerstick and palm blood (and study staff tested subject fingerstick blood) using the ONYX NEXT BGMS. All BG results were compared to reference method results obtained with subject capillary plasma. Also, study staff tested venous blood from subjects WITH Diabetes and BG results were compared to reference method results obtained from the subjects' venous plasma.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Males and females, 18 years of age and older
- Able to speak, read, and understand English
- Willing to complete all study procedures
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hemophilia or any other bleeding disorder
- Pregnancy
- Physical, visual or neurological impairments that would make the person unable to perform testing with the BGM
- Previously participated in a blood glucose monitoring study using the ONYX NEXT or ONYX PLUS BGMS
- Working for a medical laboratory, hospital, or other clinical setting that involves training on or clinical use of blood glucose monitors
- Working for a competitive medical device company, or having an immediate family member who works for such a company
- A condition which, in the opinion of the investigator or designee, would put the person or study conduct at risk
General enrollment guidelines:
- At least 70% of subjects will be younger than age 65
- At least 10% (approximately 10-15%) of subjects will be naive users
- At least 20% of subjects with diabetes will have type 1 diabetes

group.title: Persons With and Without Diabetes
group.description: Untrained Subjects WITH and WITHOUT Diabetes Use the ONYX NEXT BGMS (Blood Glucose Monitoring System). The ONYX NEXT BGMS: Untrained Persons WITH and WITHOUT Diabetes Use the ONYX NEXT BGMS (Blood Glucose Monitoring System). All BG results were compared to reference method results obtained with subject capillary plasma.

All BG results were compared to reference method results obtained with subject capillary plasma.

outcome.title: Percent of Self-Test Fingerstick Blood Glucose (BG) Results (From Subjects WITH Diabetes) Within +/- 15mg/dL (<100mg/dL) and Within +/- 15% (>=100 mg/dL) of Laboratory Glucose Method
outcome.description: Untrained subjects WITH Diabetes (332) self-tested fingerstick blood using an Investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System (BGMS). BGMS results were compared with subject capillary plasma BG results obtained with a Yellow Springs Instrument (YSI) Analyzer. YSI Analyzer BG results were used to calculate the percent of BGMS results within +/- 15 mg/dL (<100 mg/dL YSI capillary plasma) and +/- 15% (>=100 mg/dL YSI capillary plasma).
outcome.population: 329 (332 with diabetes-3) Blood glucose results were analyzed. Three subjects did not obtain meter BG result after three attempts.

group.title: Persons With Diabetes
group.description: Untrained Subjects WITH Diabetes Use the ONYX NEXT BGMS (Blood Glucose Monitoring System). ONYX NEXT BGMS: Untrained Persons WITH Diabetes Use the ONYX NEXT BGMS (Blood Glucose Monitoring System). Subjects tested capillary fingerstick blood using the ONYX NEXT BGMS. All BG results were compared to reference method results obtained with subject capillary plasma.

outcome.title: Percent of Alternate Site Palm Blood Glucose (BG) Results (From Subjects WITH Diabetes) Within +/- 15mg/dL (<100mg/dL) and Within +/- 15% (>=100 mg/dL) of Laboratory Glucose Method
outcome.description: Untrained subjects WITH Diabetes (332) self-tested Alternate Site (AST) palm blood using an Investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System (BGMS). BGMS results were compared with subject capillary plasma BG results obtained with a Yellow Springs Instrument (YSI) Analyzer. YSI Analyzer BG results were used to calculate the percent of BGMS results within +/- 15 mg/dL (<100 mg/dL YSI capillary plasma) and +/- 15% (>=100 mg/dL YSI capillary plasma).
outcome.population: 318 (332 with diabetes -14) Blood glucose results were analyzed. Nine (9) subjects with low blood sugar did not attempt palm testing per protocol. Five (5) subjects had low blood sugar; their palm results were not evaluable per protocol.

measure.population: 329 (332-3) Blood glucose results were analyzed. Three subjects did not obtain meter BG result after three attempts.

outcome.title: Percent of Responses From Persons WITH Diabetes That Either 'Strongly Agree' or 'Agree' or Are 'Neutral' With Questionnaire Statements Regarding BGMS
outcome.description: Staff obtained responses from persons WITH Diabetes (332) using short questionnaires to provide feedback on instructions for use and the basic operation of the BGMS. Subjects could respond 'Strongly Agree' or 'Agree' or are 'Neutral' or 'Disagree' or 'Strongly Disagree'.

outcome.title: Percent of Self-Test Fingerstick Blood Glucose (BG) Results (From Subjects WITH and WITHOUT Diabetes) Within +/- 15 mg/dL (<75 mg/dL) and Within +/- 15% (>= 75 mg/dL) of Laboratory Glucose Method
outcome.description: Untrained subject WITH and WITHOUT diabetes self-tested fingerstick blood using an investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System (BGMS). BGMS results were compared with subject capillary plasma BG results obtained with a Yellow Springs Instrument (YSI) Analyzer. YSI Analyzer BG results were used to calculate the percent of BGMS results within +/- 15 mg/dL (< 75 mg/dL YSI capillary plasma) and +/- 15% (>= 75 mg/dL YSI capillary plasma).
outcome.population: 372 (375 - 3) Blood glucose results were analyzed. Three subjects did not obtain meter BG results after three attempts.

group.title: Persons With and Without Diabetes
group.description: Untrained Subjects WITH and WITHOUT Diabetes Use the ONYX NEXT BGMS (Blood Glucose Monitoring System). The ONYX NEXT BGMS: Untrained Persons WITH and WITHOUT Diabetes Use the ONYX NEXT BGMS (Blood Glucose Monitoring System).

measure.title: Percent of Self-Test Fingerstick Blood Glucose (BG) Results (From Subjects WITH and WITHOUT Diabetes) Within +/- 15 mg/dL (<75 mg/dL) and Within +/- 15% (>= 75 mg/dL) of Laboratory Glucose Method
measure.description: Untrained subject WITH and WITHOUT diabetes self-tested fingerstick blood using an investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System (BGMS). BGMS results were compared with subject capillary plasma BG results obtained with a Yellow Springs Instrument (YSI) Analyzer. YSI Analyzer BG results were used to calculate the percent of BGMS results within +/- 15 mg/dL (< 75 mg/dL YSI capillary plasma) and +/- 15% (>= 75 mg/dL YSI capillary plasma).

outcome.title: Percent of Self-Test Alternate Site Palm Blood Glucose (BG) Results (From Subjects WITH and WITHOUT Diabetes) Within +/- 15 mg/dL (<75 mg/dL) and Within +/- 15% (>= 75 mg/dL) of Laboratory Glucose Method
outcome.description: Untrained subject WITH and WITHOUT diabetes self-tested Alternate Site (AST) palm blood using an investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System (BGMS). BGMS results were compared with subject capillary plasma BG results obtained with a Yellow Springs Instrument (YSI) Analyzer. YSI Analyzer BG results were used to calculate the percent of BGMS results within +/- 15 mg/dL (< 75 mg/dL YSI capillary plasma) and +/- 15% (>= 75 mg/dL YSI capillary plasma).
outcome.population: 366 (375-9) Blood glucose results were analyzed. Nine (9) subjects with low blood sugar did not attempt palm testing per protocol.

group.title: Persons With and Without Diabetes
group.description: Untrained Subjects WITH and WITHOUT Diabetes Use the ONYX NEXT BGMS (Blood Glucose Monitoring System). The ONYX NEXT BGMS: Untrained Persons WITH and WITHOUT Diabetes Use the ONYX NEXT BGMS (Blood Glucose Monitoring System).

measure.title: Percent of Self-Test Alternate Site Palm Blood Glucose (BG) Results (From Subjects WITH and WITHOUT Diabetes) Within +/- 15 mg/dL (<75 mg/dL) and Within +/- 15% (>= 75 mg/dL) of Laboratory Glucose Method
measure.description: Untrained subject WITH and WITHOUT diabetes self-tested Alternate Site (AST) palm blood using an investigational Blood Glucose Monitoring System (BGMS). BGMS results were compared with subject capillary plasma BG results obtained with a Yellow Springs Instrument (YSI) Analyzer. YSI Analyzer BG results were used to calculate the percent of BGMS results within +/- 15 mg/dL (< 75 mg/dL YSI capillary plasma) and +/- 15% (>= 75 mg/dL YSI capillary plasma).
measure.population: 366 (375-9) Blood glucose results were analyzed. Nine (9) subjects with low blood sugar did not attempt palm testing per protocol.

group.title: Persons With and Without Diabetes
group.description: Untrained Subjects WITH and WITHOUT Diabetes Use the ONYX NEXT BGMS (Blood Glucose Monitoring System). The ONYX NEXT BGMS: Untrained Persons WITH and WITHOUT Diabetes Use the ONYX NEXT BGMS (Blood Glucose Monitoring System). Subjects tested capillary fingerstick and palm blood (and study staff tested subject fingerstick blood) using the ONYX NEXT BGMS. All BG results were compared to reference method results obtained with subject capillary plasma.

event.description: Subjects with hypoglycemia (defined by site as BG level < 70 mg/dL) had diabetes and hypoglycemia was resolved at the visit.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Jane Wallace, Deputy Director for Global Clinical Affairs
